org.pikater.web.config

Class WebAppConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.web.config.WebAppConfiguration

  • public class WebAppConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object

    Java representation of some settings found it the "web.xml" file. These settings should not relate to Vaadin or other technologies used (there are other ways to work with them) but rather focus on settings that immediately affect the application's behaviour. At this time, only isCoreEnabled() satisfies that condition.

    Furthermore, this class defines some added value in the form of special interface not related to the application's deployment descriptor that (again) affect its behaviour. These are mainly "debug" and "devel features".

    Author:
    SkyCrawl

    • Method Detail

      • setContext

        public static void setContext(javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
        Set the web application's context. All relevant settings found in the deployment descriptor will be derived from it.
        See Also:
        #getContextParam(String)}

      • getContext

        public static javax.servlet.ServletContext getContext()
        Get the web application's context.

      • isCoreEnabled

        public static boolean isCoreEnabled()
        Determines whether the web application is set to communicate with an instance of core system.
        • If true, the application's potential should be fully brought out. Use WebToCoreEntryPoint to communicate with the core system.
        • If false, some of the application's features can not be utilized to the fullest - experiments can not be queued for example. Only database related features remain unlimited.

      • avoidUsingDBForNow

        public static boolean avoidUsingDBForNow()
        Convenience method for development purposes.
        Signals what kind of data should be used throughout the application.
        • If true, some dummy generated data.
        • If false, data from database.
        This is useful to allow offline development when the database is offline or under maintenance.

      • isApplicationReadyToServe

        public static boolean isApplicationReadyToServe()
        Whether the application has been launched successfully and a valid configuration has been parsed.

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid()
        Whether settings derived from the web deployment descriptor are all valid.
